column1: Mapping the use of simulation in prehospital care - a literature review
column2:
Simulation methods: manikins, films, images or paper, live actors, animals and virtual reality
Staff categories: paramedics, emergency medical technicians, medical doctors, nurse and fire fighters.
Main topics: intubation, trauma care, CPR, ventilation and triage.
CONCLUSIONS: current state reveals inadequate skills regarding:
 - ventilation
 - CPR
 - resuscitation in pediatrics
 - assessing and manging burn victims
The simulation methods are ordered taking into account their presence in the studies; this means that manikins were the simulation method used in more studies.
With respect to the participants, simulation focused on paramedics has increased, has decreased in emergency medical technicians and in the rest, remains stable.
Conclusions with respecto to the impact of simulation as a method for education in trauma care, performance and assessment.
Ventilation was the area with most published articles and ventilation the most infrequent.
